metadata.Title: CVE-2017-14608 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In LibRaw through 0.18.4, an out of bounds read flaw related to kodak_65000_load_raw has been reported in dcraw/dcraw.c and internal/dcraw_common.cpp. An attacker could possibly exploit this flaw to disclose potentially sensitive memory or cause an application crash.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-14608` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libraw-bin - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
libraw15 - 0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: darktable package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
dcraw package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
exactimage package in xenial is affected and needs fixing.
kodi package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
libraw package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.17.1-1ubuntu0.1').
rawtherapee package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
ufraw package in xenial is affected and may need fixing.
